name: monotonically
content:
monotonically adverb
(SOUND)
Add to word list
Add to word list
formal with the sound staying on the same note without going higher or lower when someone is speaking: Speak with expression, not monotonically. He speaks monotonically, with little intonation.
More examplesFewer examplesAuditory items were spoken monotonically by a female voice.He found that words spoken monotonically are more effective than face expressions seen in a film without sound.The user can select any of 63 different pitch levels, and have words spoken either monotonically or with intonation.

monotonically adverb
(QUANTITY)
mathematics
  specialized in a way that only ever increases, or only ever gets less: The average values of all variables change monotonically. The estimated genetic variance declines monotonically with age.
More examplesFewer examplesOthers have found that CO2 increases monotonically with income.You could also go back to that linearly, monotonically increasing kind of graph.
